              local BATS_RELEASE_NOTES="/tmp/bats-release-${NEW_BATS_VERSION}"
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            
            

            

            
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            
            

            

              echo "Releasing: ${BATS_VERSION} to ${NEW_BATS_VERSION}"
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            
            

            

              echo
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            
            

            

            
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            
            

            

              echo "Ensure docs/CHANGELOG.md is correctly updated"
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            
            

            

            
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            
            

            

              replace_in_files
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            
            

            

            
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            
            

            

              write_changelog
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            
            

            

            
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            
            

            

              git diff --staged
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            
            

            

            
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            
            

            

              cat <<EOF
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            
            

            

            1. Version numbers have been updated. Commit the changes:
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            
            

            

            
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            
            

            

            git commit -m "feat: release Bats v${NEW_BATS_VERSION}"
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            
            

            

            
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            
            

            

            2. Verify this autogenerated changelog (from docs/CHANGELOG.md):
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            
            

            

            
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            
            

            

            # changelog start
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            
            

            

            EOF
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            
            

            

            
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            
            

            

              local DELIM
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            
            

            

              DELIM=$(echo -en "\001")
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            
            

            

              sed -E -n "\\${DELIM}^## \[${NEW_BATS_VERSION}\]${DELIM},\\${DELIM}^## ${DELIM}p" docs/CHANGELOG.md |
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            
            

            

                head -n -1 |
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            
            

            

                sed -E \
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            
            

            

                  -e 's,^## \[([0-9\.]+)] - (.*),Bats \1\n\nReleased: \2,' \
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            
            

            

                  -e 's,^### (.*),\1:,g' |
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            
            

            

                tee "${BATS_RELEASE_NOTES}"
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            
            

            

            
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            
            

            

              cat <<EOF
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            
            

            

            # changelog end
          
      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            
            

            

            
          
      80. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    80. 
            
            

            

            3. Tag the release using the autogenerated changelog:
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            
            

            

            
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            
            

            

            git tag -a -s "v${NEW_BATS_VERSION}" --message "${BATS_RELEASE_NOTES}"
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            
            

            

            
          
      84. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    84. 
            
            

            

            4. Push the changes:
          
      85. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    85. 
            
            

            

            
          
      86. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    86. 
            
            

            

            git push --follow-tags
          
      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87. 
            
            

            

            
          
      88. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    88. 
            
            

            

            5. Use GitHub hub to make a draft release:
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            
            

            

            
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            
            

            

            hub release create "v${NEW_BATS_VERSION}" --draft --file "${BATS_RELEASE_NOTES}"
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            
            

            

            
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            
            

            

            6. Navigate to the provided URL, verify changes, and release Bats ${NEW_BATS_VERSION}.
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            
            

            

            EOF
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            
            

            

            
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            
            

            

              exit 0
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            
            

            

            
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            
            

            

            replace_in_files() {
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            
            

            

              declare -a FILE_REPLACEMENTS=(
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            
            

            

                "contrib/rpm/bats.spec,^Version:"
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            
            

            

                "libexec/bats-core/bats,^export BATS_VERSION="
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102. 
            
            

            

                "package.json,^  \"version\":"
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            
            

            

              )
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            
            

            

            
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            
            

            

              for FILE_REPLACEMENT in "${FILE_REPLACEMENTS[@]}"; do
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            
            

            

                FILE="${FILE_REPLACEMENT/,*/}"
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            
            

            

                MATCH="${FILE_REPLACEMENT/*,/}"
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            
            

            

                sed -E -i.bak "/${MATCH}/ { s,${BATS_VERSION},${NEW_BATS_VERSION},g; }" "${FILE}"
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            
            

            

                rm "${FILE}.bak" || true
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            
            

            

                git add -f "${FILE}"
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            
            

            

              done
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            
            

            

            
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            
            

            

            write_changelog() {
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            
            

            

              local FILE="docs/CHANGELOG.md"
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            
            

            

              sed -E -i.bak "/## \[Unreleased\]/ a \\\n## [${NEW_BATS_VERSION}] - $(date +%Y-%m-%d)" "${FILE}"
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            
            

            

            
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            
            

            

              rm "${FILE}.bak" || true
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            
            

            

            
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            
            

            

              cp "${FILE}" "${FILE}.new"
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            
            

            

              sed -E -i.bak '/## \[Unreleased\]/,+1d' "${FILE}"
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            
            

            

              git add -f "${FILE}"
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            
            

            

              mv "${FILE}.new" "${FILE}"
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            
            

            

            
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            
            

            

            handle_arguments() {
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            
            

            

              parse_arguments "${@:-}"
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            
            

            

            
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            
            

            

            parse_arguments() {
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            
            

            

              local CURRENT_ARG
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            
            

            

            
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            
            

            

              if [[ "${#}" == 1 && "${1:-}" == "" ]]; then
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            
            

            

                return 0
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            
            

            

              fi
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            
            

            

            
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            
            

            

              while [[ "${#}" -gt 0 ]]; do
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            
            

            

                CURRENT_ARG="${1}"
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            
            

            

            
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            
            

            

                case ${CURRENT_ARG} in
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            
            

            

                --major)
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            
            

            

                  BUMP_INTERVAL="major"
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            
            

            

                  ;;
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            
            

            

                # ---
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            
            

            

                --minor)
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            
            

            

                  BUMP_INTERVAL="minor"
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            
            

            

                  ;;
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            
            

            

                --patch)
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            
            

            

                  BUMP_INTERVAL="patch"
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            
            

            

                  ;;
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            
            

            

                -h | --help) usage ;;
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            
            

            

                -v | --version)
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            
            

            

                  get_version
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            
            

            

                  exit 0
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            
            

            

                  ;;
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            
            

            

                --debug)
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            
            

            

                  set -xe
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            
            

            

                  ;;
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            
            

            

                -*) usage "${CURRENT_ARG}: unknown option" ;;
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            
            

            

                esac
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            
            

            

                shift
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            
            

            

              done
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    164. 
            
            

            

            
          
      165. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    165. 
            
            

            

            semver() {
          
      166. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    166. 
            
            

            

              "${DIR}/semver" "${@:-}"
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            
            

            

            
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            
            

            

            usage() {
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            
            

            

              sed -n '/^##/,/^$/s/^## \{0,1\}//p' "${THIS_SCRIPT}" | sed "s/%SCRIPT_NAME%/$(basename "${THIS_SCRIPT}")/g"
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            
            

            

              exit 2
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            
            

            

            } 2>/dev/null
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            
            

            

            
          
      174. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    174. 
            
            

            

            get_version() {
          
      175. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    175. 
            
            

            

              echo "${THIS_SCRIPT_VERSION:-0.1}"
          
      176. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    176. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      177. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    177. 
            
            

            

            
          
      178. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    178. 
            
            

            

            main "${@}"
          
      179.

    test/bats/contrib/semver

    0.0% lines covered

    202 relevant lines. 0 lines covered and 202 lines missed. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1. 
            
            

            

            #!/usr/bin/env bash
          
      2. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    2. 
            
            

            

            
          
      3. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    3. 
            
            

            

            # v3.0.0
          
      4. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    4. 
            
            

            

            # https://github.com/fsaintjacques/semver-tool
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            
            

            

            
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            
            

            

            set -o errexit -o nounset -o pipefail
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            
            

            

            
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            
            

            

            NAT='0|[1-9][0-9]*'
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            
            

            

            ALPHANUM='[0-9]*[A-Za-z-][0-9A-Za-z-]*'
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            
            

            

            IDENT="$NAT|$ALPHANUM"
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            
            

            

            FIELD='[0-9A-Za-z-]+'
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            
            

            

            
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            
            

            

            SEMVER_REGEX="\
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            
            

            

            ^[vV]?\
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            
            

            

            ($NAT)\\.($NAT)\\.($NAT)\
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            
            

            

            (\\-(${IDENT})(\\.(${IDENT}))*)?\
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            
            

            

            (\\+${FIELD}(\\.${FIELD})*)?$"
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            
            

            

            
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            
            

            

            PROG=semver
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            
            

            

            PROG_VERSION="3.0.0"
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            
            

            

            
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            
            

            

            USAGE="\
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            
            

            

            Usage:
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            
            

            

              $PROG bump (major|minor|patch|release|prerel <prerel>|build <build>) <version>
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
            

            

              $PROG compare <version> <other_version>
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
            

            

              $PROG get (major|minor|patch|release|prerel|build) <version>
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            
            

            

              $PROG --help
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

              $PROG --version
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            
            

            

            
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            
            

            

            Arguments:
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
            

            

              <version>  A version must match the following regular expression:
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            
            

            

                         \"${SEMVER_REGEX}\"
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            
            

            

                         In English:
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            
            

            

                         -- The version must match X.Y.Z[-PRERELEASE][+BUILD]
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            
            

            

                            where X, Y and Z are non-negative integers.
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            
            

            

                         -- PRERELEASE is a dot separated sequence of non-negative integers and/or
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            
            

            

                            identifiers composed of alphanumeric characters and hyphens (with
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            
            

            

                            at least one non-digit). Numeric identifiers must not have leading
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            
            

            

                            zeros. A hyphen (\"-\") introduces this optional part.
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            
            

            

                         -- BUILD is a dot separated sequence of identifiers composed of alphanumeric
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            
            

            

                            characters and hyphens. A plus (\"+\") introduces this optional part.
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            
            

            

            
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            
            

            

              <other_version>  See <version> definition.
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            
            

            

            
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            
            

            

              <prerel>  A string as defined by PRERELEASE above.
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            
            

            

            
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            
            

            

              <build>   A string as defined by BUILD above.
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            
            

            

            
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            
            

            

            Options:
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            
            

            

              -v, --version          Print the version of this tool.
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            
            

            

              -h, --help             Print this help message.
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            
            

            

            
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            
            

            

            Commands:
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            
            

            

              bump     Bump by one of major, minor, patch; zeroing or removing
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            
            

            

                       subsequent parts. \"bump prerel\" sets the PRERELEASE part and
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            
            

            

                       removes any BUILD part. \"bump build\" sets the BUILD part.
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            
            

            

                       \"bump release\" removes any PRERELEASE or BUILD parts.
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            
            

            

                       The bumped version is written to stdout.
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            
            

            

            
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            
            

            

              compare  Compare <version> with <other_version>, output to stdout the
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            
            

            

                       following values: -1 if <other_version> is newer, 0 if equal, 1 if
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            
            

            

                       older. The BUILD part is not used in comparisons.
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            
            

            

            
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            
            

            

              get      Extract given part of <version>, where part is one of major, minor,
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            
            

            

                       patch, prerel, build, or release.
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            
            

            

            
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            
            

            

            See also:
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            
            

            

              https://semver.org -- Semantic Versioning 2.0.0"
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            
            

            

            
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            
            

            

            function error {
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            
            

            

              echo -e "$1" >&2
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            
            

            

              exit 1
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            
            

            

            
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            
            

            

            function usage-help {
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            
            

            

              error "$USAGE"
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            
            

            

            
          
      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            
            

            

            function usage-version {
          
      80. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    80. 
            
            

            

              echo -e "${PROG}: $PROG_VERSION"
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            
            

            

              exit 0
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            
            

            

            
          
      84. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    84. 
            
            

            

            function validate-version {
          
      85. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    85. 
            
            

            

              local version=$1
          
      86. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    86. 
            
            

            

              if [[ "$version" =~ $SEMVER_REGEX ]]; then
          
      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87. 
            
            

            

                # if a second argument is passed, store the result in var named by $2
          
      88. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    88. 
            
            

            

                if [ "$#" -eq "2" ]; then
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            
            

            

                  local major=${BASH_REMATCH[1]}
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            
            

            

                  local minor=${BASH_REMATCH[2]}
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            
            

            

                  local patch=${BASH_REMATCH[3]}
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            
            

            

                  local prere=${BASH_REMATCH[4]}
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            
            

            

                  local build=${BASH_REMATCH[8]}
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            
            

            

                  eval "$2=(\"$major\" \"$minor\" \"$patch\" \"$prere\" \"$build\")"
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            
            

            

                else
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            
            

            

                  echo "$version"
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            
            

            

                fi
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            
            

            

              else
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            
            

            

                error "version $version does not match the semver scheme 'X.Y.Z(-PRERELEASE)(+BUILD)'. See help for more information."
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            
            

            

              fi
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102. 
            
            

            

            
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            
            

            

            function is-nat {
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            
            

            

              [[ "$1" =~ ^($NAT)$ ]]
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            
            

            

            
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            
            

            

            function is-null {
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            
            

            

              [ -z "$1" ]
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            
            

            

            
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            
            

            

            function order-nat {
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            
            

            

              [ "$1" -lt "$2" ] && {
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            
            

            

                echo -1
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            
            

            

                return
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            
            

            

              }
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            
            

            

              [ "$1" -gt "$2" ] && {
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            
            

            

                echo 1
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            
            

            

                return
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            
            

            

              }
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            
            

            

              echo 0
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            
            

            

            
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            
            

            

            function order-string {
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            
            

            

              [[ $1 < $2 ]] && {
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            
            

            

                echo -1
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            
            

            

                return
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            
            

            

              }
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128. 
            
            

            

              [[ $1 > $2 ]] && {
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            
            

            

                echo 1
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            
            

            

                return
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            
            

            

              }
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            
            

            

              echo 0
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            
            

            

            
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            
            

            

            # given two (named) arrays containing NAT and/or ALPHANUM fields, compare them
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            
            

            

            # one by one according to semver 2.0.0 spec. Return -1, 0, 1 if left array ($1)
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            
            

            

            # is less-than, equal, or greater-than the right array ($2).  The longer array
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            
            

            

            # is considered greater-than the shorter if the shorter is a prefix of the longer.
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            
            

            

            #
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            
            

            

            function compare-fields {
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            
            

            

              local l="$1[@]"
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            
            

            

              local r="$2[@]"
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            
            

            

              local leftfield=("${!l}")
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            
            

            

              local rightfield=("${!r}")
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            
            

            

              local left
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            
            

            

              local right
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            
            

            

            
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            
            

            

              local i=$((-1))
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            
            

            

              local order=$((0))
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            
            

            

            
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            
            

            

              while true; do
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            
            

            

                [ $order -ne 0 ] && {
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            
            

            

                  echo $order
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            
            

            

                  return
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            
            

            

                }
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            
            

            

            
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            
            

            

                : $((i++))
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            
            

            

                left="${leftfield[$i]}"
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            
            

            

                right="${rightfield[$i]}"
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            
            

            

            
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            
            

            

                is-null "$left" && is-null "$right" && {
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            
            

            

                  echo 0
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            
            

            

                  return
          
      164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    164. 
            
            

            

                }
          
      165. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    165. 
            
            

            

                is-null "$left" && {
          
      166. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    166. 
            
            

            

                  echo -1
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            
            

            

                  return
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            
            

            

                }
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            
            

            

                is-null "$right" && {
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            
            

            

                  echo 1
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            
            

            

                  return
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            
            

            

                }
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            
            

            

            
          
      174. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    174. 
            
            

            

                is-nat "$left" && is-nat "$right" && {
          
      175. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    175. 
            
            

            

                  order=$(order-nat "$left" "$right")
          
      176. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    176. 
            
            

            

                  continue
          
      177. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    177. 
            
            

            

                }
          
      178. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    178. 
            
            

            

                is-nat "$left" && {
          
      179. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    179. 
            
            

            

                  echo -1
          
      180. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    180. 
            
            

            

                  return
          
      181. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    181. 
            
            

            

                }
          
      182. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    182. 
            
            

            

                is-nat "$right" && {
          
      183. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    183. 
            
            

            

                  echo 1
          
      184. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    184. 
            
            

            

                  return
          
      185. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    185. 
            
            

            

                }
          
      186. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    186. 
            
            

            

                {
          
      187. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    187. 
            
            

            

                  order=$(order-string "$left" "$right")
          
      188. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    188. 
            
            

            

                  continue
          
      189. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    189. 
            
            

            

                }
          
      190. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    190. 
            
            

            

              done
          
      191. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    191. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      192. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    192. 
            
            

            

            
          
      193. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    193. 
            
            

            

            # shellcheck disable=SC2206     # checked by "validate"; ok to expand prerel id's into array
          
      194. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    194. 
            
            

            

            function compare-version {
          
      195. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    195. 
            
            

            

              local order
          
      196. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    196. 
            
            

            

              validate-version "$1" V
          
      197. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    197. 
            
            

            

              validate-version "$2" V_
          
      198. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    198. 
            
            

            

            
          
      199. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    199. 
            
            

            

              # compare major, minor, patch
          
      200. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    200. 
            
            

            

            
          
      201. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    201. 
            
            

            

              local left=("${V[0]}" "${V[1]}" "${V[2]}")
          
      202. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    202. 
            
            

            

              local right=("${V_[0]}" "${V_[1]}" "${V_[2]}")
          
      203. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    203. 
            
            

            

            
          
      204. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    204. 
            
            

            

              order=$(compare-fields left right)
          
      205. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    205. 
            
            

            

              [ "$order" -ne 0 ] && {
          
      206. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    206. 
            
            

            

                echo "$order"
          
      207. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    207. 
            
            

            

                return
          
      208. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    208. 
            
            

            

              }
          
      209. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    209. 
            
            

            

            
          
      210. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    210. 
            
            

            

              # compare pre-release ids when M.m.p are equal
          
      211. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    211. 
            
            

            

            
          
      212. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    212. 
            
            

            

              local prerel="${V[3]:1}"
          
      213. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    213. 
            
            

            

              local prerel_="${V_[3]:1}"
          
      214. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    214. 
            
            

            

              local left=(${prerel//./ })
          
      215. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    215. 
            
            

            

              local right=(${prerel_//./ })
          
      216. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    216. 
            
            

            

            
          
      217. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    217. 
            
            

            

              # if left and right have no pre-release part, then left equals right
          
      218. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    218. 
            
            

            

              # if only one of left/right has pre-release part, that one is less than simple M.m.p
          
      219. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    219. 
            
            

            

            
          
      220. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    220. 
            
            

            

              [ -z "$prerel" ] && [ -z "$prerel_" ] && {
          
      221. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    221. 
            
            

            

                echo 0
          
      222. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    222. 
            
            

            

                return
          
      223. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    223. 
            
            

            

              }
          
      224. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    224. 
            
            

            

              [ -z "$prerel" ] && {
          
      225. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    225. 
            
            

            

                echo 1
          
      226. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    226. 
            
            

            

                return
          
      227. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    227. 
            
            

            

              }
          
      228. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    228. 
            
            

            

              [ -z "$prerel_" ] && {
          
      229. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    229. 
            
            

            

                echo -1
          
      230. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    230. 
            
            

            

                return
          
      231. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    231. 
            
            

            

              }
          
      232. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    232. 
            
            

            

            
          
      233. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    233. 
            
            

            

              # otherwise, compare the pre-release id's
          
      234. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    234. 
            
            

            

            
          
      235. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    235. 
            
            

            

              compare-fields left right
          
      236. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    236. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      237. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    237. 
            
            

            

            
          
      238. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    238. 
            
            

            

            function command-bump {
          
      239. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    239. 
            
            

            

              local new
          
      240. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    240. 
            
            

            

              local version
          
      241. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    241. 
            
            

            

              local sub_version
          
      242. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    242. 
            
            

            

              local command
          
      243. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    243. 
            
            

            

            
          
      244. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    244. 
            
            

            

              case $# in
          
      245. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    245. 
            
            

            

              2) case $1 in
          
      246. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    246. 
            
            

            

                major | minor | patch | release)
          
      247. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    247. 
            
            

            

                  command=$1
          
      248. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    248. 
            
            

            

                  version=$2
          
      249. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    249. 
            
            

            

                  ;;
          
      250. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    250. 
            
            

            

                *) usage-help ;;
          
      251. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    251. 
            
            

            

                esac ;;
          
      252. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    252. 
            
            

            

              3) case $1 in
          
      253. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    253. 
            
            

            

                prerel | build)
          
      254. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    254. 
            
            

            

                  command=$1
          
      255. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    255. 
            
            

            

                  sub_version=$2 version=$3
          
      256. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    256. 
            
            

            

                  ;;
          
      257. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    257. 
            
            

            

                *) usage-help ;;
          
      258. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    258. 
            
            

            

                esac ;;
          
      259. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    259. 
            
            

            

              *) usage-help ;;
          
      260. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    260. 
            
            

            

              esac
          
      261. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    261. 
            
            

            

            
          
      262. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    262. 
            
            

            

              validate-version "$version" parts
          
      263. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    263. 
            
            

            

              # shellcheck disable=SC2154
          
      264. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    264. 
            
            

            

              local major="${parts[0]}"
          
      265. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    265. 
            
            

            

              local minor="${parts[1]}"
          
      266. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    266. 
            
            

            

              local patch="${parts[2]}"
          
      267. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    267. 
            
            

            

              local prere="${parts[3]}"
          
      268. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    268. 
            
            

            

              local build="${parts[4]}"
          
      269. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    269. 
            
            

            

            
          
      270. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    270. 
            
            

            

              case "$command" in
          
      271. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    271. 
            
            

            

              major) new="$((major + 1)).0.0" ;;
          
      272. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    272. 
            
            

            

              minor) new="${major}.$((minor + 1)).0" ;;
          
      273. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    273. 
            
            

            

              patch) new="${major}.${minor}.$((patch + 1))" ;;
          
      274. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    274. 
            
            

            

              release) new="${major}.${minor}.${patch}" ;;
          
      275. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    275. 
            
            

            

              prerel) new=$(validate-version "${major}.${minor}.${patch}-${sub_version}") ;;
          
      276. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    276. 
            
            

            

              build) new=$(validate-version "${major}.${minor}.${patch}${prere}+${sub_version}") ;;
          
      277. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    277. 
            
            

            

              *) usage-help ;;
          
      278. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    278. 
            
            

            

              esac
          
      279. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    279. 
            
            

            

            
          
      280. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    280. 
            
            

            

              echo "$new"
          
      281. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    281. 
            
            

            

              exit 0
          
      282. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    282. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      283. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    283. 
            
            

            

            
          
      284. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    284. 
            
            

            

            function command-compare {
          
      285. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    285. 
            
            

            

              local v
          
      286. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    286. 
            
            

            

              local v_
          
      287. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    287. 
            
            

            

            
          
      288. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    288. 
            
            

            

              case $# in
          
      289. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    289. 
            
            

            

              2)
          
      290. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    290. 
            
            

            

                v=$(validate-version "$1")
          
      291. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    291. 
            
            

            

                v_=$(validate-version "$2")
          
      292. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    292. 
            
            

            

                ;;
          
      293. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    293. 
            
            

            

              *) usage-help ;;
          
      294. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    294. 
            
            

            

              esac
          
      295. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    295. 
            
            

            

            
          
      296. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    296. 
            
            

            

              set +u # need unset array element to evaluate to null
          
      297. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    297. 
            
            

            

              compare-version "$v" "$v_"
          
      298. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    298. 
            
            

            

              exit 0
          
      299. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    299. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      300. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    300. 
            
            

            

            
          
      301. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    301. 
            
            

            

            # shellcheck disable=SC2034
          
      302. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    302. 
            
            

            

            function command-get {
          
      303. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    303. 
            
            

            

              local part version
          
      304. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    304. 
            
            

            

            
          
      305. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    305. 
            
            

            

              if [[ "$#" -ne "2" ]] || [[ -z "$1" ]] || [[ -z "$2" ]]; then
          
      306. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    306. 
            
            

            

                usage-help
          
      307. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    307. 
            
            

            

                exit 0
          
      308. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    308. 
            
            

            

              fi
          
      309. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    309. 
            
            

            

            
          
      310. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    310. 
            
            

            

              part="$1"
          
      311. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    311. 
            
            

            

              version="$2"
          
      312. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    312. 
            
            

            

            
          
      313. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    313. 
            
            

            

              validate-version "$version" parts
          
      314. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    314. 
            
            

            

              local major="${parts[0]}"
          
      315. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    315. 
            
            

            

              local minor="${parts[1]}"
          
      316. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    316. 
            
            

            

              local patch="${parts[2]}"
          
      317. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    317. 
            
            

            

              local prerel="${parts[3]:1}"
          
      318. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    318. 
            
            

            

              local build="${parts[4]:1}"
          
      319. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    319. 
            
            

            

              local release="${major}.${minor}.${patch}"
          
      320. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    320. 
            
            

            

            
          
      321. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    321. 
            
            

            

              case "$part" in
          
      322. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    322. 
            
            

            

              major | minor | patch | release | prerel | build) echo "${!part}" ;;
          
      323. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    323. 
            
            

            

              *) usage-help ;;
          
      324. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    324. 
            
            

            

              esac
          
      325. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    325. 
            
            

            

            
          
      326. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    326. 
            
            

            

              exit 0
          
      327. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    327. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      328. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    328. 
            
            

            

            
          
      329. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    329. 
            
            

            

            case $# in
          
      330. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    330. 
            
            

            

            0)
          
      331. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    331. 
            
            

            

              echo "Unknown command: $*"
          
      332. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    332. 
            
            

            

              usage-help
          
      333. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    333. 
            
            

            

              ;;
          
      334. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    334. 
            
            

            

            esac
          
      335. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    335. 
            
            

            

            
          
      336. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    336. 
            
            

            

            case $1 in
          
      337. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    337. 
            
            

            

            --help | -h)
          
      338. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    338. 
            
            

            

              echo -e "$USAGE"
          
      339. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    339. 
            
            

            

              exit 0
          
      340. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    340. 
            
            

            

              ;;
          
      341. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    341. 
            
            

            

            --version | -v) usage-version ;;
          
      342. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    342. 
            
            

            

            bump)
          
      343. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    343. 
            
            

            

              shift
          
      344. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    344. 
            
            

            

              command-bump "$@"
          
      345. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    345. 
            
            

            

              ;;
          
      346. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    346. 
            
            

            

            get)
          
      347. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    347. 
            
            

            

              shift
          
      348. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    348. 
            
            

            

              command-get "$@"
          
      349. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    349. 
            
            

            

              ;;
          
      350. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    350. 
            
            

            

            compare)
          
      351. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    351. 
            
            

            

              shift
          
      352. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    352. 
            
            

            

              command-compare "$@"
          
      353. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    353. 
            
            

            

              ;;
          
      354. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    354. 
            
            

            

            *)
          
      355. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    355. 
            
            

            

              echo "Unknown arguments: $*"
          
      356. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    356.

      357. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    357. 
            
            

            

              ;;
          
      358. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    358. 
            
            

            

            esac

            create_temp_dirs() {
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            
            

            

                mkdir -p "${TMPDIR}/${1}"

                if [[ ${LIBNAME} != "detik" ]]; then

                    mkdir -p "${DESTDIR}/bats-${1}/src"

            download_extract_source() {
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            
            

            

                wget -qO- ${BASEURL}/bats-"${1}"/archive/refs/tags/v"${2}".tar.gz | tar xz -C "${TMPDIR}/${1}" --strip-components 1
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      34.
