    132. 
            
            

            

            # Returns:
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            
            

            

            #   0 - character special file exists
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            
            

            

            #   1 - otherwise
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            
            

            

            # Outputs:
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            
            

            

            #   STDERR - details, on failure
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            
            

            

            assert_character_exists() {
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            
            

            

              local -r file="$1"
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            
            

            

              if [[ ! -c "$file" ]]; then
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            
            

            

                local -r rem="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_REM-}"
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            
            

            

                local -r add="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_ADD-}"
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            
            

            

                batslib_print_kv_single 4 'path' "${file/$rem/$add}" \
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            
            

            

                  | batslib_decorate 'character special file does not exist' \
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            
            

            

                  | fail
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            
            

            

              fi
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            
            

            

            
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            
            

            

            # Fail and display path of the symbolic link if it does not exist.
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            
            

            

            # This function is the logical complement of `assert_link_not_exists'.
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            
            

            

            #
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            
            

            

            # Globals:
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            
            

            

            #   BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_REM
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            
            

            

            #   BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_ADD
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            
            

            

            # Arguments:
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            
            

            

            #   $1 - path
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            
            

            

            # Returns:
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            
            

            

            #   0 - symbolic link exists
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            
            

            

            #   1 - otherwise
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            
            

            

            # Outputs:
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            
            

            

            #   STDERR - details, on failure
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            
            

            

            assert_link_exists() {
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            
            

            

              local -r file="$1"
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            
            

            

              if [[ ! -L "$file" ]]; then
          
      164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    164. 
            
            

            

                local -r rem="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_REM-}"
          
      165. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    165. 
            
            

            

                local -r add="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_ADD-}"
          
      166. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    166. 
            
            

            

                batslib_print_kv_single 4 'path' "${file/$rem/$add}" \
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            
            

            

                  | batslib_decorate 'symbolic link does not exist' \
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            
            

            

                  | fail
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            
            

            

              fi
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            
            

            

            
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            
            

            

            # Fail and display path of the socket if it does not exist.
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            
            

            

            # This function is the logical complement of `assert_socket_not_exists'.
          
      174. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    174. 
            
            

            

            #
          
      175. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    175. 
            
            

            

            # Globals:
          
      176. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    176. 
            
            

            

            #   BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_REM
          
      177. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    177. 
            
            

            

            #   BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_ADD
          
      178. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    178. 
            
            

            

            # Arguments:
          
      179. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    179. 
            
            

            

            #   $1 - path
          
      180. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    180. 
            
            

            

            # Returns:
          
      181. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    181. 
            
            

            

            #   0 - socket exists
          
      182. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    182. 
            
            

            

            #   1 - otherwise
          
      183. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    183. 
            
            

            

            # Outputs:
          
      184. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    184. 
            
            

            

            #   STDERR - details, on failure
          
      185. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    185. 
            
            

            

            assert_socket_exists() {
          
      186. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    186. 
            
            

            

              local -r file="$1"
          
      187. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    187. 
            
            

            

              if [[ ! -S "$file" ]]; then
          
      188. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    188. 
            
            

            

                local -r rem="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_REM-}"
          
      189. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    189. 
            
            

            

                local -r add="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_ADD-}"
          
      190. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    190. 
            
            

            

                batslib_print_kv_single 4 'path' "${file/$rem/$add}" \
          
      191. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    191. 
            
            

            

                  | batslib_decorate 'socket does not exist' \
          
      192. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    192. 
            
            

            

                  | fail
          
      193. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    193. 
            
            

            

              fi
          
      194. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    194. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      195. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    195. 
            
            

            

            
          
      196. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    196. 
            
            

            

            # Fail and display path of the named pipe if it does not exist.
          
      197. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    197. 
            
            

            

            # This function is the logical complement of `assert_fifo_not_exists'.
          
      198. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    198. 
            
            

            

            #
          
      199. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    199. 
            
            

            

            # Globals:
          
      200. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    200. 
            
            

            

            #   BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_REM
          
      201. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    201. 
            
            

            

            #   BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_ADD
          
      202. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    202. 
            
            

            

            # Arguments:
          
      203. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    203. 
            
            

            

            #   $1 - path
          
      204. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    204. 
            
            

            

            # Returns:
          
      205. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    205. 
            
            

            

            #   0 - named pipe exists
          
      206. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    206. 
            
            

            

            #   1 - otherwise
          
      207. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    207. 
            
            

            

            # Outputs:
          
      208. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    208. 
            
            

            

            #   STDERR - details, on failure
          
      209. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    209. 
            
            

            

            assert_fifo_exists() {
          
      210. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    210. 
            
            

            

              local -r file="$1"
          
      211. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    211. 
            
            

            

              if [[ ! -p "$file" ]]; then
          
      212. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    212. 
            
            

            

                local -r rem="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_REM-}"
          
      213. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    213. 
            
            

            

                local -r add="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_ADD-}"
          
      214. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    214. 
            
            

            

                batslib_print_kv_single 4 'path' "${file/$rem/$add}" \
          
      215. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    215. 
            
            

            

                  | batslib_decorate 'fifo does not exist' \
          
      216. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    216. 
            
            

            

                  | fail
          
      217. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    217. 
            
            

            

              fi
          
      218. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    218. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      219. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    219. 
            
            

            

            
          
      220. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    220. 
            
            

            

            # Fail and display path of the named file if it is not executable.
          
      221. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    221. 
            
            

            

            # This function is the logical complement of `assert_file_not_executable'.
          
      222. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    222. 
            
            

            

            #
          
      223. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    223. 
            
            

            

            # Globals:
          
      224. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    224. 
            
            

            

            #   BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_REM
          
      225. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    225. 
            
            

            

            #   BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_ADD
          
      226. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    226. 
            
            

            

            # Arguments:
          
      227. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    227. 
            
            

            

            #   $1 - path
          
      228. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    228. 
            
            

            

            # Returns:
          
      229. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    229. 
            
            

            

            #   0 - named pipe exists
          
      230. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    230. 
            
            

            

            #   1 - otherwise
          
      231. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    231. 
            
            

            

            # Outputs:
          
      232. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    232. 
            
            

            

            #   STDERR - details, on failure
          
      233. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    233. 
            
            

            

            assert_file_executable() {
          
      234. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    234. 
            
            

            

              local -r file="$1"
          
      235. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    235. 
            
            

            

              if [[ ! -x "$file" ]]; then
          
      236. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    236. 
            
            

            

                local -r rem="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_REM-}"
          
      237. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    237. 
            
            

            

                local -r add="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_ADD-}"
          
      238. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    238. 
            
            

            

                batslib_print_kv_single 4 'path' "${file/$rem/$add}" \
          
      239. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    239. 
            
            

            

                  | batslib_decorate 'file is not executable' \
          
      240. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    240. 
            
            

            

                  | fail
          
      241. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    241. 
            
            

            

              fi
          
      242. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    242. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      243. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    243. 
            
            

            

            
          
      244. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    244. 
            
            

            

            # Fail and display path of both files if they are not equal.
          
      245. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    245. 
            
            

            

            # This function is the logical complement of `assert_files_not_equal'.
          
      246. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    246. 
            
            

            

            #
          
      247. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    247. 
            
            

            

            # Globals:
          
      248. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    248. 
            
            

            

            #   BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_REM
          
      249. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    249. 
            
            

            

            #   BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_ADD
          
      250. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    250. 
            
            

            

            # Arguments:
          
      251. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    251. 
            
            

            

            #   $1 - 1st path
          
      252. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    252. 
            
            

            

            #   $2 - 2nd path
          
      253. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    253. 
            
            

            

            # Returns:
          
      254. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    254. 
            
            

            

            #   0 - named files are the same
          
      255. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    255. 
            
            

            

            #   1 - otherwise
          
      256. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    256. 
            
            

            

            # Outputs:
          
      257. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    257. 
            
            

            

            #   STDERR - details, on failure
          
      258. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    258. 
            
            

            

            assert_files_equal() {
          
      259. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    259. 
            
            

            

              local -r file1="$1"
          
      260. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    260. 
            
            

            

              local -r file2="$2"
          
      261. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    261. 
            
            

            

              if ! cmp -s "$file1" "$file2" >/dev/null ; then
          
      262. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    262. 
            
            

            

                local -r rem="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_REM-}"
          
      263. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    263. 
            
            

            

                local -r add="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_ADD-}"
          
      264. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    264. 
            
            

            

                batslib_print_kv_single 4 'path' "${file1/$rem/$add}" 'path' "${file2/$rem/$add}" \
          
      265. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    265. 
            
            

            

                  | batslib_decorate 'files are not the same' \
          
      266. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    266. 
            
            

            

                  | fail
          
      267. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    267. 
            
            

            

              fi
          
      268. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    268. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      269. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    269. 
            
            

            

            
          
      270. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    270. 
            
            

            

            # Get the owner of a file
          
      271. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    271. 
            
            

            

            # Arguments:
          
      272. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    272. 
            
            

            

            # $1 - output variable name
          
      273. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    273. 
            
            

            

            # $2 - path to file
          
      274. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    274. 
            
            

            

            _bats_get_file_owner() {
          
      275. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    275. 
            
            

            

              local -r output_var=$1
          
      276. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    276. 
            
            

            

              local -r file=$2
          
      277. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    277. 
            
            

            

              if [[ "$OSTYPE" == darwin* ]]; then
          
      278. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    278. 
            
            

            

                  local -ra cmd_params=(-f %Su)
          
      279. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    279. 
            
            

            

              else
          
      280. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    280. 
            
            

            

                  local -ra cmd_params=(-c %U)
          
      281. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    281. 
            
            

            

              fi
          
      282. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    282. 
            
            

            

              printf -v "$output_var" "%s" "$(stat "${cmd_params[@]}" "$file")"
          
      283. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    283. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      284. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    284. 
            
            

            

            
          
      285. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    285. 
            
            

            

            # Fail and display path of the user is not the owner of a file. This
          
      286. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    286. 
            
            

            

            # function is the logical complement of `assert_file_not_owner'.
          
      287. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    287. 
            
            

            

            #
          
      288. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    288. 
            
            

            

            # Globals:
          
      289. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    289. 
            
            

            

            #   BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_REM
          
      290. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    290. 
            
            

            

            #   BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_ADD
          
      291. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    291. 
            
            

            

            # Arguments:
          
      292. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    292. 
            
            

            

            #   $1 - path
          
      293. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    293. 
            
            

            

            # Returns:
          
      294. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    294. 
            
            

            

            #   0 - owns file
          
      295. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    295. 
            
            

            

            #   1 - otherwise
          
      296. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    296. 
            
            

            

            # Outputs:
          
      297. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    297. 
            
            

            

            #   STDERR - details, on failure
          
      298. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    298. 
            
            

            

            assert_file_owner() {
          
      299. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    299. 
            
            

            

              local -r owner="$1"
          
      300. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    300. 
            
            

            

              local -r file="$2"
          
      301. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    301. 
            
            

            

              
          
      302. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    302. 
            
            

            

              local actual_owner
          
      303. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    303. 
            
            

            

              _bats_get_file_owner actual_owner "$file"
          
      304. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    304. 
            
            

            

              readonly actual_owner
          
      305. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    305. 
            
            

            

            
          
      306. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    306. 
            
            

            

              if [[ "$actual_owner" != "$owner" ]]; then
          
      307. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    307. 
            
            

            

                local -r rem="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_REM-}"
          
      308. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    308. 
            
            

            

                local -r add="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_ADD-}"
          
      309. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    309. 
            
            

            

                batslib_print_kv_single 4 'path' "${file/$rem/$add}" \
          
      310. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    310. 
            
            

            

                  | batslib_decorate "user $owner is not the owner of the file" \
          
      311. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    311. 
            
            

            

                  | fail
          
      312. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    312. 
            
            

            

              fi
          
      313. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    313. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      314. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    314. 
            
            

            

            
          
      315. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    315. 
            
            

            

            # Fail if file does not have given permissions. This
          
      316. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    316. 
            
            

            

            # function is the logical complement of `assert_file_not_permission'.
          
      317. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    317. 
            
            

            

            #
          
      318. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    318. 
            
            

            

            # Globals:
          
      319. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    319. 
            
            

            

            #   BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_REM
          
      320. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    320. 
            
            

            

            #   BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_ADD
          
      321. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    321. 
            
            

            

            # Arguments:
          
      322. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    322. 
            
            

            

            #   $1 - permission
          
      323. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    323. 
            
            

            

            #   $2 - path
          
      324. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    324. 
            
            

            

            # Returns:
          
      325. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    325. 
            
            

            

            #   0 - file has given permissions
          
      326. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    326. 
            
            

            

            #   1 - otherwise
          
      327. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    327. 
            
            

            

            # Outputs:
          
      328. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    328. 
            
            

            

            #   STDERR - details, on failure
          
      329. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    329. 
            
            

            

            assert_file_permission() {
          
      330. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    330. 
            
            

            

              local -r permission="$1"
          
      331. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    331. 
            
            

            

              local -r file="$2"
          
      332. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    332. 
            
            

            

            
          
      333. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    333. 
            
            

            

              if [[ "$OSTYPE" == darwin* ]]; then
          
      334. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    334. 
            
            

            

                  local -r actual_permission=$(stat -f '%A' "$file")
          
      335. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    335. 
            
            

            

              else
          
      336. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    336. 
            
            

            

                  local -r actual_permission=$(stat -c "%a" "$file")
          
      337. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    337. 
            
            

            

              fi
          
      338. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    338. 
            
            

            

            
          
      339. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    339. 
            
            

            

              if [[ "$actual_permission" != "$permission" ]]; then
          
      340. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    340. 
            
            

            

                local -r rem="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_REM-}"
          
      341. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    341. 
            
            

            

                local -r add="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_ADD-}"
          
      342. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    342. 
            
            

            

                batslib_print_kv_single 4 'path' "${file/$rem/$add}" \
          
      343. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    343. 
            
            

            

                  | batslib_decorate "file does not have permissions $permission" \
          
      344. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    344. 
            
            

            

                  | fail
          
      345. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    345. 
            
            

            

              fi
          
      346. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    346. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      347. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    347. 
            
            

            

            
          
      348. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    348. 
            
            

            

            # Fail if file is not zero byte. This
          
      349. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    349. 
            
            

            

            # function is the logical complement of `assert_size_not_zero'.
          
      350. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    350. 
            
            

            

            #
          
      351. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    351. 
            
            

            

            # Globals:
          
      352. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    352. 
            
            

            

            #   BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_REM
          
      353. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    353. 
            
            

            

            #   BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_ADD
          
      354. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    354. 
            
            

            

            # Arguments:
          
      355. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    355. 
            
            

            

            #   $1 - path
          
      356. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    356. 
            
            

            

            # Returns:
          
      357. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    357. 
            
            

            

            #   0 - file size is zero byte
          
      358. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    358. 
            
            

            

            #   1 - otherwise
          
      359. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    359. 
            
            

            

            # Outputs:
          
      360. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    360. 
            
            

            

            #   STDERR - details, on failure
          
      361. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    361. 
            
            

            

            assert_size_zero() {
          
      362. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    362. 
            
            

            

              local -r file="$1"
          
      363. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    363. 
            
            

            

            
          
      364. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    364. 
            
            

            

              if [ -s "$file" ]; then
          
      365. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    365. 
            
            

            

                local -r rem="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_REM-}"
          
      366. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    366. 
            
            

            

                local -r add="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_ADD-}"
          
      367. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    367. 
            
            

            

                batslib_print_kv_single 4 'path' "${file/$rem/$add}" \
          
      368. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    368. 
            
            

            

                  | batslib_decorate 'file is greater than 0 byte' \
          
      369. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    369. 
            
            

            

                  | fail
          
      370. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    370. 
            
            

            

              fi
          
      371. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    371. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      372. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    372. 
            
            

            

            
          
      373. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    373. 
            
            

            

            # Fail if group if is not set on file. This
          
      374. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    374. 
            
            

            

            # function is the logical complement of `assert_file_not_group_id_set'.
          
      375. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    375. 
            
            

            

            #
          
      376. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    376. 
            
            

            

            # Globals:
          
      377. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    377. 
            
            

            

            #   BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_REM
          
      378. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    378. 
            
            

            

            #   BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_ADD
          
      379. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    379. 
            
            

            

            # Arguments:
          
      380. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    380. 
            
            

            

            #   $1 - path
          
      381. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    381. 
            
            

            

            # Returns:
          
      382. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    382. 
            
            

            

            #   0 - group id is set
          
      383. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    383. 
            
            

            

            #   1 - otherwise
          
      384. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    384. 
            
            

            

            # Outputs:
          
      385. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    385. 
            
            

            

            #   STDERR - details, on failure
          
      386. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    386. 
            
            

            

            assert_file_group_id_set() {
          
      387. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    387. 
            
            

            

              local -r file="$1"
          
      388. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    388. 
            
            

            

              if [[ ! -g "$file" ]]; then
          
      389. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    389. 
            
            

            

                local -r rem="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_REM-}"
          
      390. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    390. 
            
            

            

                local -r add="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_ADD-}"
          
      391. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    391. 
            
            

            

                batslib_print_kv_single 4 'path' "${file/$rem/$add}" \
          
      392. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    392. 
            
            

            

                  | batslib_decorate 'set-group-ID is not set' \
          
      393. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    393. 
            
            

            

                  | fail
          
      394. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    394. 
            
            

            

              fi
          
      395. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    395. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      396. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    396. 
            
            

            

            
          
      397. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    397. 
            
            

            

            # Fail if user if is not set on file. This
          
      398. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    398. 
            
            

            

            # function is the logical complement of `assert_file_not_user_id_set'.
          
      399. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    399. 
            
            

            

            #
          
      400. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    400. 
            
            

            

            # Globals:
          
      401. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    401. 
            
            

            

            #   BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_REM
          
      402. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    402. 
            
            

            

            #   BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_ADD
          
      403. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    403. 
            
            

            

            # Arguments:
          
      404. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    404. 
            
            

            

            #   $1 - path
          
      405. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    405. 
            
            

            

            # Returns:
          
      406. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    406. 
            
            

            

            #   0 - user id is set
          
      407. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    407. 
            
            

            

            #   1 - otherwise
          
      408. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    408. 
            
            

            

            # Outputs:
          
      409. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    409. 
            
            

            

            #   STDERR - details, on failure
          
      410. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    410. 
            
            

            

            assert_file_user_id_set() {
          
      411. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    411. 
            
            

            

              local -r file="$1"
          
      412. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    412. 
            
            

            

              if [[ ! -u "$file" ]]; then
          
      413. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    413. 
            
            

            

                local -r rem="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_REM-}"
          
      414. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    414. 
            
            

            

                local -r add="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_ADD-}"
          
      415. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    415. 
            
            

            

                batslib_print_kv_single 4 'path' "${file/$rem/$add}" \
          
      416. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    416. 
            
            

            

                  | batslib_decorate 'set-user-ID is not set' \
          
      417. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    417. 
            
            

            

                  | fail
          
      418. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    418. 
            
            

            

              fi
          
      419. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    419. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      420. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    420. 
            
            

            

            
          
      421. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    421. 
            
            

            

            # Fail if stickybit not set on file. This
          
      422. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    422. 
            
            

            

            # function is the logical complement of `assert_sticky_bit'.
          
      423. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    423. 
            
            

            

            #
          
      424. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    424. 
            
            

            

            # Globals:
          
      425. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    425. 
            
            

            

            #   BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_REM
          
      426. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    426. 
            
            

            

            #   BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_ADD
          
      427. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    427. 
            
            

            

            # Arguments:
          
      428. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    428. 
            
            

            

            #   $1 - path
          
      429. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    429. 
            
            

            

            # Returns:
          
      430. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    430. 
            
            

            

            #   0 - stickybit is set
          
      431. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    431. 
            
            

            

            #   1 - otherwise
          
      432. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    432. 
            
            

            

            # Outputs:
          
      433. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    433. 
            
            

            

            #   STDERR - details, on failure
          
      434. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    434. 
            
            

            

            assert_sticky_bit() {
          
      435. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    435. 
            
            

            

              local -r file="$1"
          
      436. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    436. 
            
            

            

              if [[ ! -k "$file" ]]; then
          
      437. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    437. 
            
            

            

                local -r rem="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_REM-}"
          
      438. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    438. 
            
            

            

                local -r add="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_ADD-}"
          
      439. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    439. 
            
            

            

                batslib_print_kv_single 4 'path' "${file/$rem/$add}" \
          
      440. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    440. 
            
            

            

                  | batslib_decorate 'stickybit is not set' \
          
      441. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    441. 
            
            

            

                  | fail
          
      442. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    442. 
            
            

            

              fi
          
      443. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    443. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      444. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    444. 
            
            

            

            
          
      445. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    445. 
            
            

            

            _bats_file_readlinkf_macos() {
          
      446. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    446. 
            
            

            

              local TARGET_FILE=$1
          
      447. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    447. 
            
            

            

              cd "$(dirname "$TARGET_FILE")" 2>/dev/null || return
          
      448. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    448. 
            
            

            

              TARGET_FILE=$(basename "$TARGET_FILE")
          
      449. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    449. 
            
            

            

              # Iterate down a (possible) chain of symlinks
          
      450. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    450. 
            
            

            

              while [ -L "$TARGET_FILE" ]
          
      451. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    451. 
            
            

            

              do
          
      452. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    452. 
            
            

            

                TARGET_FILE=$(readlink "$TARGET_FILE")
          
      453. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    453. 
            
            

            

                cd "$(dirname "$TARGET_FILE")" 2>/dev/null || return
          
      454. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    454. 
            
            

            

                TARGET_FILE=$(basename "$TARGET_FILE")
          
      455. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    455. 
            
            

            

              done
          
      456. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    456. 
            
            

            

              # Compute the canonicalized name by finding the physical path
          
      457. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    457. 
            
            

            

              # for the directory we're in and appending the target file.
          
      458. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    458. 
            
            

            

              local -r PHYS_DIR=$(pwd -P)
          
      459. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    459. 
            
            

            

            
          
      460. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    460. 
            
            

            

              printf "%s/%s\n" "$PHYS_DIR" "$TARGET_FILE"
          
      461. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    461. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      462. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    462. 
            
            

            

            
          
      463. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    463. 
            
            

            

            # Fail and display path of the file (or directory) if it is not a symlink to given destination.
          
      464. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    464. 
            
            

            

            # function is the logical complement of `assert_not_symlink_to`
          
      465. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    465. 
            
            

            

            #   $1 - source
          
      466. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    466. 
            
            

            

            #   $2 - destination
          
      467. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    467. 
            
            

            

            # Returns:
          
      468. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    468. 
            
            

            

            #   0 - link to correct target
          
      469. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    469. 
            
            

            

            #   1 - otherwise
          
      470. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    470. 
            
            

            

            # Outputs:
          
      471. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    471. 
            
            

            

            #   STDERR - details, on failure
          
      472. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    472. 
            
            

            

            assert_symlink_to() {
          
      473. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    473. 
            
            

            

              local -r sourcefile="$1"
          
      474. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    474. 
            
            

            

              local -r link="$2"
          
      475. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    475. 
            
            

            

            
          
      476. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    476. 
            
            

            

              # If OS is OSX, emulate readlink -f
          
      477. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    477. 
            
            

            

              if [[ $OSTYPE == "darwin"* ]]; then
          
      478. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    478. 
            
            

            

                local -ra readlink_command=(_bats_file_readlinkf_macos)
          
      479. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    479. 
            
            

            

              else
          
      480. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    480. 
            
            

            

                local -ra readlink_command=(readlink -f)
          
      481. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    481. 
            
            

            

              fi
          
      482. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    482. 
            
            

            

              
          
      483. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    483. 
            
            

            

              if [ ! -L "$link"   ]; then
          
      484. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    484. 
            
            

            

                local -r rem="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_REM-}"
          
      485. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    485. 
            
            

            

                local -r add="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_ADD-}"
          
      486. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    486. 
            
            

            

                batslib_print_kv_single 4 'path' "${link/$rem/$add}" \
          
      487. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    487. 
            
            

            

                  | batslib_decorate 'file is not a symbolic link' \
          
      488. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    488. 
            
            

            

                  | fail
          
      489. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    489. 
            
            

            

              fi
          
      490. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    490. 
            
            

            

            
          
      491. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    491. 
            
            

            

              local realsource; realsource=$( "${readlink_command[@]}" "$link" ); readonly realsource
          
      492. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    492. 
            
            

            

              local realexpectedsource; realexpectedsource=$( "${readlink_command[@]}" "$sourcefile" ); readonly realexpectedsource
          
      493. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    493. 
            
            

            

              if [ ! "${realsource}" = "${realexpectedsource}"  ]; then
          
      494. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    494. 
            
            

            

                local -r rem="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_REM-}"
          
      495. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    495. 
            
            

            

                local -r add="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_ADD-}"
          
      496. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    496. 
            
            

            

                batslib_print_kv_single 4 'path' "${link/$rem/$add}" \
          
      497. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    497. 
            
            

            

                  | batslib_decorate 'symbolic link does not have the correct target' \
          
      498. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    498. 
            
            

            

                  | fail
          
      499. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    499. 
            
            

            

              fi
          
      500. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    500. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      501. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    501. 
            
            

            

            # Fail and display path of the file (or directory) if it does not match a size.
          
      502. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    502. 
            
            

            

            #
          
      503. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    503. 
            
            

            

            # Globals:
          
      504. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    504. 
            
            

            

            #   BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_REM
          
      505. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    505. 
            
            

            

            #   BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_ADD
          
      506. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    506. 
            
            

            

            # Arguments:
          
      507. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    507. 
            
            

            

            #   $1 - path
          
      508. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    508. 
            
            

            

            #   $2 - expected size (bytes)
          
      509. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    509. 
            
            

            

            # Returns:
          
      510. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    510. 
            
            

            

            #   0 - file is correct size
          
      511. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    511. 
            
            

            

            #   1 - otherwise
          
      512. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    512. 
            
            

            

            # Outputs:
          
      513. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    513. 
            
            

            

            #   STDERR - details, on failure
          
      514. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    514. 
            
            

            

            assert_file_size_equals() {
          
      515. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    515. 
            
            

            

              local -r file="$1"
          
      516. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    516. 
            
            

            

              local -r expectedsize="$2"
          
      517. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    517. 
            
            

            

              local -r size=$( wc -c "$file" | awk '{print $1}' )
          
      518. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    518. 
            
            

            

              if [ ! "$expectedsize" = "$size" ]; then
          
      519. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    519. 
            
            

            

                local -r rem="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_REM-}"
          
      520. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    520. 
            
            

            

                local -r add="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_ADD-}"
          
      521. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    521. 
            
            

            

                batslib_print_kv_single 4 'path' "${file/$rem/$add}" \
          
      522. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    522. 
            
            

            

                  | batslib_decorate 'file size does not match expected size' \
          
      523. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    523. 
            
            

            

                  | fail
          
      524. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    524. 
            
            

            

              fi
          
      525. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    525. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      526. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    526. 
            
            

            

            # Fail and display path of the file (or directory) if it does not contain a string.
          
      527. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    527. 
            
            

            

            # This function is the logical complement of `assert_file_not_contains'.
          
      528. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    528. 
            
            

            

            #
          
      529. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    529. 
            
            

            

            # Globals:
          
      530. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    530. 
            
            

            

            #   BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_REM
          
      531. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    531. 
            
            

            

            #   BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_ADD
          
      532. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    532. 
            
            

            

            # Arguments:
          
      533. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    533. 
            
            

            

            #   $1 - path
          
      534. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    534. 
            
            

            

            #   $2 - regex
          
      535. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    535. 
            
            

            

            # Returns:
          
      536. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    536. 
            
            

            

            #   0 - file contains regex
          
      537. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    537. 
            
            

            

            #   1 - otherwise
          
      538. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    538. 
            
            

            

            # Outputs:
          
      539. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    539. 
            
            

            

            #   STDERR - details, on failure
          
      540. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    540. 
            
            

            

            assert_file_contains() {
          
      541. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    541. 
            
            

            

              local -r file="$1"
          
      542. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    542. 
            
            

            

              local -r regex="$2"
          
      543. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    543. 
            
            

            

              if ! grep -q "$regex" "$file"; then
          
      544. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    544. 
            
            

            

                local -r rem="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_REM-}"
          
      545. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    545. 
            
            

            

                local -r add="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_ADD-}"
          
      546. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    546. 
            
            

            

                batslib_print_kv_single 4 'path' "${file/$rem/$add}" 'regex' "$regex" \
          
      547. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    547. 
            
            

            

                  | batslib_decorate 'file does not contain regex' \
          
      548. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    548. 
            
            

            

                  | fail
          
      549. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    549. 
            
            

            

              fi
          
      550. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    550. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      551. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    551. 
            
            

            

            # Fail and display path of the file (or directory) if it is not empty.
          
      552. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    552. 
            
            

            

            # This function is the logical complement of `assert_file_not_empty'.
          
      553. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    553. 
            
            

            

            #
          
      554. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    554. 
            
            

            

            # Globals:
          
      555. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    555. 
            
            

            

            #   BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_REM
          
      556. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    556. 
            
            

            

            #   BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_ADD
          
      557. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    557. 
            
            

            

            # Arguments:
          
      558. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    558. 
            
            

            

            #   $1 - path
          
      559. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    559. 
            
            

            

            # Returns:
          
      560. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    560. 
            
            

            

            #   0 - file empty
          
      561. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    561. 
            
            

            

            #   1 - otherwise
          
      562. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    562. 
            
            

            

            # Outputs:
          
      563. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    563. 
            
            

            

            #   STDERR - details, on failure
          
      564. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    564. 
            
            

            

            assert_file_empty() {
          
      565. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    565. 
            
            

            

              local -r file="$1"
          
      566. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    566. 
            
            

            

              if [[ -s "$file" ]]; then
          
      567. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    567. 
            
            

            

                local -r rem="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_REM-}"
          
      568. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    568. 
            
            

            

                local -r add="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_ADD-}"
          
      569. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    569. 
            
            

            

                { local -ir width=8
          
      570. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    570. 
            
            

            

                  batslib_print_kv_single "$width" 'path' "${file/$rem/$add}"
          
      571. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    571. 
            
            

            

                  batslib_print_kv_single_or_multi "$width" \
          
      572. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    572. 
            
            

            

                      'output' "$(cat "$file")"
          
      573. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    573. 
            
            

            

                } | batslib_decorate 'file is not empty' \
          
      574. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    574. 
            
            

            

                  | fail
          
      575. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    575. 
            
            

            

              fi
          
      576. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    576. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      577. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    577. 
            
            

            

            # Fail and display path of the file (or directory) if it exists. This
          
      578. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    578. 
            
            

            

            # function is the logical complement of `assert_exists'.
          
      579. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    579. 
            
            

            

            #
          
      580. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    580. 
            
            

            

            # Globals:
          
      581. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    581. 
            
            

            

            #   BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_REM
          
      582. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    582. 
            
            

            

            #   BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_ADD
          
      583. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    583. 
            
            

            

            # Arguments:
          
      584. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    584. 
            
            

            

            #   $1 - path
          
      585. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    585. 
            
            

            

            # Returns:
          
      586. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    586. 
            
            

            

            #   0 - file does not exist
          
      587. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    587. 
            
            

            

            #   1 - otherwise
          
      588. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    588. 
            
            

            

            # Outputs:
          
      589. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    589. 
            
            

            

            #   STDERR - details, on failure
          
      590. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    590. 
            
            

            

            assert_not_exists() {
          
      591. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    591. 
            
            

            

              local -r file="$1"
          
      592. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    592. 
            
            

            

              if [[ -e "$file" ]]; then
          
      593. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    593. 
            
            

            

                local -r rem="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_REM-}"
          
      594. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    594. 
            
            

            

                local -r add="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_ADD-}"
          
      595. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    595. 
            
            

            

                batslib_print_kv_single 4 'path' "${file/$rem/$add}" \
          
      596. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    596. 
            
            

            

                  | batslib_decorate 'file or directory exists, but it was expected to be absent' \
          
      597. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    597. 
            
            

            

                  | fail
          
      598. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    598. 
            
            

            

              fi
          
      599. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    599. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      600. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    600. 
            
            

            

            
          
      601. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    601. 
            
            

            

            # Fail and display path of the file if it exists. This
          
      602. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    602. 
            
            

            

            # function is the logical complement of `assert_file_exists'.
          
      603. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    603. 
            
            

            

            #
          
      604. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    604. 
            
            

            

            # Globals:
          
      605. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    605. 
            
            

            

            #   BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_REM
          
      606. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    606. 
            
            

            

            #   BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_ADD
          
      607. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    607. 
            
            

            

            # Arguments:
          
      608. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    608. 
            
            

            

            #   $1 - path
          
      609. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    609. 
            
            

            

            # Returns:
          
      610. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    610. 
            
            

            

            #   0 - file does not exist
          
      611. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    611. 
            
            

            

            #   1 - otherwise
          
      612. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    612. 
            
            

            

            # Outputs:
          
      613. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    613. 
            
            

            

            #   STDERR - details, on failure
          
      614. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    614. 
            
            

            

            assert_file_not_exists() {
          
      615. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    615. 
            
            

            

              local -r file="$1"
          
      616. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    616. 
            
            

            

              if [[ -f "$file" ]]; then
          
      617. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    617. 
            
            

            

                local -r rem="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_REM-}"
          
      618. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    618. 
            
            

            

                local -r add="${BATSLIB_FILE_PATH_ADD-}"
          
      619. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    619. 
            
            

            

                batslib_print_kv_single 4 'path' "${file/$rem/$add}" \
          
      620. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    620. 
            
            

            

                  | batslib_decorate 'file exists, but it was expected to be absent' \
          
      621.
