    33. 
            
            

            

            # Inputs:
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            
            

            

            #   STDIN - [=$@] message
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            
            

            

            # Outputs:
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            
            

            

            #   STDERR - message
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            
            

            

            batslib_err() {
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            
            

            

              { if (( $# > 0 )); then
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            
            

            

                  echo "$@"
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            
            

            

                else
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            
            

            

                  cat -
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            
            

            

                fi
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            
            

            

              } >&2
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            
            

            

            
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            
            

            

            # Count the number of lines in the given string.
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            
            

            

            #
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            
            

            

            # TODO(ztombol): Fix tests and remove this note after #93 is resolved!
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            
            

            

            # NOTE: Due to a bug in Bats, `batslib_count_lines "$output"' does not
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            
            

            

            #       give the same result as `${#lines[@]}' when the output contains
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            
            

            

            #       empty lines.
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            
            

            

            #       See PR #93 (https://github.com/sstephenson/bats/pull/93).
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            
            

            

            #
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            
            

            

            # Globals:
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            
            

            

            #   none
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            
            

            

            # Arguments:
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            
            

            

            #   $1 - string
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            
            

            

            # Returns:
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            
            

            

            #   none
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            
            

            

            # Outputs:
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            
            

            

            #   STDOUT - number of lines
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            
            

            

            batslib_count_lines() {
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            
            

            

              local -i n_lines=0
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            
            

            

              local line
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            
            

            

              while IFS='' read -r line || [[ -n $line ]]; do
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            
            

            

                (( ++n_lines ))
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            
            

            

              done < <(printf '%s' "$1")
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            
            

            

              echo "$n_lines"
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            
            

            

            
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            
            

            

            # Determine whether all strings are single-line.
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            
            

            

            #
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            
            

            

            # Globals:
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            
            

            

            #   none
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            
            

            

            # Arguments:
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            
            

            

            #   $@ - strings
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            
            

            

            # Returns:
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            
            

            

            #   0 - all strings are single-line
          
      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            
            

            

            #   1 - otherwise
          
      80. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    80. 
            
            

            

            batslib_is_single_line() {
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            
            

            

              for string in "$@"; do
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            
            

            

                (( $(batslib_count_lines "$string") > 1 )) && return 1
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            
            

            

              done
          
      84. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    84. 
            
            

            

              return 0
          
      85. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    85. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      86. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    86. 
            
            

            

            
          
      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87. 
            
            

            

            # Determine the length of the longest key that has a single-line value.
          
      88. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    88. 
            
            

            

            #
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            
            

            

            # This function is useful in determining the correct width of the key
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            
            

            

            # column in two-column format when some keys may have multi-line values
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            
            

            

            # and thus should be excluded.
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            
            

            

            #
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            
            

            

            # Globals:
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            
            

            

            #   none
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            
            

            

            # Arguments:
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            
            

            

            #   $odd - key
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            
            

            

            #   $even - value of the previous key
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            
            

            

            # Returns:
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            
            

            

            #   none
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            
            

            

            # Outputs:
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            
            

            

            #   STDOUT - length of longest key
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102. 
            
            

            

            batslib_get_max_single_line_key_width() {
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            
            

            

              local -i max_len=-1
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            
            

            

              while (( $# != 0 )); do
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            
            

            

                local -i key_len="${#1}"
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            
            

            

                batslib_is_single_line "$2" && (( key_len > max_len )) && max_len="$key_len"
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            
            

            

                shift 2
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            
            

            

              done
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            
            

            

              echo "$max_len"
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            
            

            

            
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            
            

            

            # Print key-value pairs in two-column format.
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            
            

            

            #
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            
            

            

            # Keys are displayed in the first column, and their corresponding values
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            
            

            

            # in the second. To evenly line up values, the key column is fixed-width
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            
            

            

            # and its width is specified with the first parameter (possibly computed
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            
            

            

            # using `batslib_get_max_single_line_key_width').
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            
            

            

            #
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            
            

            

            # Globals:
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            
            

            

            #   none
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            
            

            

            # Arguments:
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            
            

            

            #   $1 - width of key column
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            
            

            

            #   $even - key
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            
            

            

            #   $odd - value of the previous key
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            
            

            

            # Returns:
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            
            

            

            #   none
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            
            

            

            # Outputs:
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128. 
            
            

            

            #   STDOUT - formatted key-value pairs
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            
            

            

            batslib_print_kv_single() {
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            
            

            

              local -ir col_width="$1"; shift
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            
            

            

              while (( $# != 0 )); do
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            
            

            

                printf '%-*s : %s\n' "$col_width" "$1" "$2"
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            
            

            

                shift 2
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            
            

            

              done
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            
            

            

            
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            
            

            

            # Print key-value pairs in multi-line format.
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            
            

            

            #
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            
            

            

            # The key is displayed first with the number of lines of its
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            
            

            

            # corresponding value in parenthesis. Next, starting on the next line,
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            
            

            

            # the value is displayed. For better readability, it is recommended to
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            
            

            

            # indent values using `batslib_prefix'.
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            
            

            

            #
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            
            

            

            # Globals:
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            
            

            

            #   none
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            
            

            

            # Arguments:
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            
            

            

            #   $odd - key
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            
            

            

            #   $even - value of the previous key
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            
            

            

            # Returns:
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            
            

            

            #   none
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            
            

            

            # Outputs:
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            
            

            

            #   STDOUT - formatted key-value pairs
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            
            

            

            batslib_print_kv_multi() {
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            
            

            

              while (( $# != 0 )); do
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            
            

            

                printf '%s (%d lines):\n' "$1" "$( batslib_count_lines "$2" )"
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            
            

            

                printf '%s\n' "$2"
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            
            

            

                shift 2
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            
            

            

              done
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            
            

            

            
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            
            

            

            # Print all key-value pairs in either two-column or multi-line format
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            
            

            

            # depending on whether all values are single-line.
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            
            

            

            #
          
      164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    164. 
            
            

            

            # If all values are single-line, print all pairs in two-column format
          
      165. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    165. 
            
            

            

            # with the specified key column width (identical to using
          
      166. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    166. 
            
            

            

            # `batslib_print_kv_single').
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            
            

            

            #
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            
            

            

            # Otherwise, print all pairs in multi-line format after indenting values
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            
            

            

            # with two spaces for readability (identical to using `batslib_prefix'
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            
            

            

            # and `batslib_print_kv_multi')
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            
            

            

            #
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            
            

            

            # Globals:
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            
            

            

            #   none
          
      174. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    174. 
            
            

            

            # Arguments:
          
      175. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    175. 
            
            

            

            #   $1 - width of key column (for two-column format)
          
      176. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    176. 
            
            

            

            #   $even - key
          
      177. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    177. 
            
            

            

            #   $odd - value of the previous key
          
      178. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    178. 
            
            

            

            # Returns:
          
      179. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    179. 
            
            

            

            #   none
          
      180. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    180. 
            
            

            

            # Outputs:
          
      181. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    181. 
            
            

            

            #   STDOUT - formatted key-value pairs
          
      182. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    182. 
            
            

            

            batslib_print_kv_single_or_multi() {
          
      183. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    183. 
            
            

            

              local -ir width="$1"; shift
          
      184. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    184. 
            
            

            

              local -a pairs=( "$@" )
          
      185. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    185. 
            
            

            

            
          
      186. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    186. 
            
            

            

              local -a values=()
          
      187. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    187. 
            
            

            

              local -i i
          
      188. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    188. 
            
            

            

              for (( i=1; i < ${#pairs[@]}; i+=2 )); do
          
      189. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    189. 
            
            

            

                values+=( "${pairs[$i]}" )
          
      190. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    190. 
            
            

            

              done
          
      191. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    191. 
            
            

            

            
          
      192. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    192. 
            
            

            

              if batslib_is_single_line "${values[@]}"; then
          
      193. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    193. 
            
            

            

                batslib_print_kv_single "$width" "${pairs[@]}"
          
      194. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    194. 
            
            

            

              else
          
      195. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    195. 
            
            

            

                local -i i
          
      196. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    196. 
            
            

            

                for (( i=1; i < ${#pairs[@]}; i+=2 )); do
          
      197. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    197. 
            
            

            

                  pairs[$i]="$( batslib_prefix < <(printf '%s' "${pairs[$i]}") )"
          
      198. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    198. 
            
            

            

                done
          
      199. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    199. 
            
            

            

                batslib_print_kv_multi "${pairs[@]}"
          
      200. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    200. 
            
            

            

              fi
          
      201. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    201. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      202. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    202. 
            
            

            

            
          
      203. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    203. 
            
            

            

            # Prefix each line read from the standard input with the given string.
          
      204. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    204. 
            
            

            

            #
          
      205. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    205. 
            
            

            

            # Globals:
          
      206. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    206. 
            
            

            

            #   none
          
      207. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    207. 
            
            

            

            # Arguments:
          
      208. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    208. 
            
            

            

            #   $1 - [=  ] prefix string
          
      209. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    209. 
            
            

            

            # Returns:
          
      210. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    210. 
            
            

            

            #   none
          
      211. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    211. 
            
            

            

            # Inputs:
          
      212. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    212. 
            
            

            

            #   STDIN - lines
          
      213. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    213. 
            
            

            

            # Outputs:
          
      214. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    214. 
            
            

            

            #   STDOUT - prefixed lines
          
      215. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    215. 
            
            

            

            batslib_prefix() {
          
      216. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    216. 
            
            

            

              local -r prefix="${1:-  }"
          
      217. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    217. 
            
            

            

              local line
          
      218. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    218. 
            
            

            

              while IFS='' read -r line || [[ -n $line ]]; do
          
      219. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    219. 
            
            

            

                printf '%s%s\n' "$prefix" "$line"
          
      220. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    220. 
            
            

            

              done
          
      221. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    221. 
            
            

            

            }
          
      222. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    222. 
            
            

            

            
          
      223. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    223. 
            
            

            

            # Mark select lines of the text read from the standard input by
          
      224. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    224. 
            
            

            

            # overwriting their beginning with the given string.
          
      225. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    225. 
            
            

            

            #
          
      226. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    226. 
            
            

            

            # Usually the input is indented by a few spaces using `batslib_prefix'
          
      227. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    227. 
            
            

            

            # first.
          
      228. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    228. 
            
            

            

            #
          
      229. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    229. 
            
            

            

            # Globals:
          
      230. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    230. 
            
            

            

            #   none
          
      231. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    231. 
            
            

            

            # Arguments:
          
      232. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    232. 
            
            

            

            #   $1 - marking string
          
      233. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    233. 
            
            

            

            #   $@ - indices (zero-based) of lines to mark
          
      234. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    234. 
            
            

            

            # Returns:
          
      235. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    235. 
            
            

            

            #   none
          
      236. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    236. 
            
            

            

            # Inputs:
          
      237. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    237. 
            
            

            

            #   STDIN - lines
          
      238. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    238. 
            
            

            

            # Outputs:
          
      239. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    239. 
            
            

            

            #   STDOUT - lines after marking
          
      240. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    240. 
            
            

            

            batslib_mark() {
          
      241. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    241. 
            
            

            

              local -r symbol="$1"; shift
          
      242. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    242. 
            
            

            

              # Sort line numbers.
          
      243. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    243. 
            
            

            

              set -- $( sort -nu <<< "$( printf '%d\n' "$@" )" )
          
      244. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    244. 
            
            

            

            
          
      245. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    245. 
            
            

            

              local line
          
      246. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    246. 
            
            

            

              local -i idx=0
          
      247. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    247. 
            
            

            

              while IFS='' read -r line || [[ -n $line ]]; do
          
      248. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    248. 
            
            

            

                if (( ${1:--1} == idx )); then
          
      249. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    249. 
            
            

            

                  printf '%s\n' "${symbol}${line:${#symbol}}"
          
      250. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    250. 
            
            

            

                  shift
          
      251. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    251. 
            
            

            

                else
          
      252. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    252. 
            
            

            

                  printf '%s\n' "$line"
          
      253. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    253. 
            
            

            

                fi
          
      254. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    254. 
            
            

            

                (( ++idx ))
          
      255. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    255. 
            
            

            

              done

            # Enclose the input text in header and footer lines.

            # The header contains the given string as title. The output is preceded

            api_validation() {

    103.

            push_validation() {
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            
            

            

              success_api=$(echo "${1}" | grep -o '"success":[^,]*' | grep -o '[^:]*$')

              if [ "$success_api" == false ]; then

    121. 
            
            

            

            }

            external_validation() {
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            6
            

            

              if [ -z "$1" ]; then
          
      124.

                error_msg "Error! Can't get external $2 from $get_ip_from"

            3
            

            

                exit 0

    127. 
            3
            

            

                blue_bold_msg "Current External $2 is: $1"

                return 1

            internal_validation() {
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            
            

            

              if [ -z "$1" ]; then
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133.

                return 1
